title: Add "unknown advisory" detection
body:
Fixes #64.
Warn if a advisory should be ignored that does not exist at all.

Example:
```
➜  test2 git:(master) ✗ ~/git/cargo-deny/target/debug/cargo-deny check advisories
warning: this advisory is not in any RustSec database
   ┌─ /tmp/test2/deny.toml:49:5
   │
49 │     "RUSTSEC-0000-0000",
   │     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ unknown advisory

warning: advisory was not encountered
   ┌─ /tmp/test2/deny.toml:48:5
   │
48 │     "RUSTSEC-2020-0036",
   │     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ no crate matched advisory criteria

advisories ok
```

title: Normalize source URLs
body:
Fixes #115.
As said in the linked issue we should discus if this is enough normalization. Also I am not sure if it is a good idea to change values in the validation step.

Besides do the normalization I also adapted the test file so that the new feature will be tested. This test fails with the old version version of cargo-deny and passes with the changes in this PR.

title: Add MSRV to README/CI
body:
As pointed out in #265, trying to do `cargo install` requires the latest stable rust version (1.46 as of now) due to the transitive dependency on `smol_str`. This PR pins that dependency to `0.1.16` which doesn't require latest stable.

This PR also adds a badge to the README stating the Minimum Stable Rust Version that this crate (and all targets) can be built with, as well as adds a CI check to ensure we don't accidentally change the minimum version during development.

Resolves: #265

title: Add `fix` subcommand
body:
This change adds a `fix` subcommand, which attempts to automatically update cargo manifests to use versions of a crate that are unaffected by advisories.

The algorithm we use differs from the one currently used in `cargo audit`, as that one only allows patching of direct dependencies, but it's much more likely (especially in larger projects) that the crate which an advisory applies to is a transitive dependency, potentially multiple times, so we instead start at each vulnerable crate and walk up the crate graph until all local/workspace crates have been reached, gathering the set of versions that include 1 or more of the "good" versions of the dependent crate.

Due to the nature of crate graphs, this fix command is basically a best effort of trying to patch as many crates as it can, and printing warnings when it is unable to do so as there are a number of reasons a patch can't be (fully) applied.

1. No new versions of the crate are available or the advisory has not been updated to denote the fix versions.
1. No version of a crate has a published version which has semver compatibility with 1 or more of the versions that are required for the patch, recursively. This will by far be the most likely reason for a partial patch.
1. The semver requirements for 1 or more crates is not compatible. This can be overridden via `--allow-incompatible`.

This is what a dry run currently looks like, displaying the patch that would be applied by the fix subcommand

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2316028/93370098-9a6b0b00-f850-11ea-9602-4890586cf8ef.png)

Additional changes:

1. Adds support for `unsound` advisories
1. Changes the logic introduced in #244 to support multiple advisory databases, we now use a single root directory (default: `~/.cargo/advisory-dbs`) under which each db is placed in a directory with canonicalized format, similar to how cargo places registry indexes

TODO:

Need to fixup error reporting so that it's clear where and why an advisory can't be patched.

Resolves: #242

title: Fix link to the cargo-deny init template in the cargo-deny book
body:
The cargo-deny template file created by calling `cargo deny init` at some point moved from `resources/` to the root of the repo. The book links to the `init` template twice, but after this change, the links to the template in the book were not corrected, causing an inclusion failure as reported by mdbook. It can also be seen here: https://embarkstudios.github.io/cargo-deny/cli/init.html#template

This PR fixes the links by correcting the [init.md](https://github.com/EmbarkStudios/cargo-deny/blob/1d6052fc1f7761d42e65c70b3b9190423e74cd2d/docs/src/cli/init.md) file to point to the [new](https://github.com/EmbarkStudios/cargo-deny/blob/1d6052fc1f7761d42e65c70b3b9190423e74cd2d/src/cargo-deny/init.rs#L14) [location](https://github.com/EmbarkStudios/cargo-deny/blob/1d6052fc1f7761d42e65c70b3b9190423e74cd2d/deny.template.toml) of the template file. 

```
# before fix
2020-08-29 18:31:21 [INFO] (mdbook::book): Book building has started
2020-08-29 18:31:21 [ERROR] (mdbook::preprocess::links): Error updating "{{#include ../../../resources/template.toml}}", Could not read file for link {{#include ../../../resources/template.toml}} (/ws/cargo-deny/docs/src/cli/../../../resources/template.toml)
2020-08-29 18:31:21 [WARN] (mdbook::preprocess::links): Caused By: The system cannot find the file specified. (os error 2)
2020-08-29 18:31:21 [INFO] (mdbook::book): Running the html backend
2020-08-29 18:31:22 [INFO] (mdbook::cmd::serve): Serving on: http://localhost:3000
2020-08-29 18:31:22 [INFO] (warp::server): Server::run; addr=V6([::1]:3000)
2020-08-29 18:31:22 [INFO] (warp::server): listening on http://[::1]:3000
2020-08-29 18:31:22 [INFO] (mdbook::cmd::watch): Listening for changes...
# after fix
2020-08-29 18:35:12 [INFO] (mdbook::cmd::serve): Files changed: ["/ws/cargo-deny/docs/src/cli/init.md"]
2020-08-29 18:35:12 [INFO] (mdbook::cmd::serve): Building book...
2020-08-29 18:35:12 [INFO] (mdbook::book): Book building has started
2020-08-29 18:35:12 [INFO] (mdbook::book): Running the html backend
```

title: Allow wildcard dependencies by default
body:
At least until #241 has been resolved, because right now every project using cargo-deny will get warnings by default on all of their valid local file dependencies. Which is not a that good of a default.

Once we've fixed that issue we should however switch this back to warn on wildcards, it is a good opinionated default (if it works fully)

title: Print diagnostic for missing clarification files
body: Resolves: #190

title: Implement multiple advisory databases
body:
Instead of using and creating a single `Database` instance,
you will now create a `DatabaseCollection`, which mirrors the API
of a single `Database`, but queries the results from multiple databases.

Resolves #69

title: Implement standalone feature
body:
This PR introduces the new build feature `standalone`. 
If this feature is enabled, `cargo-deny` doesn't use the `cargo` binary on the system, but the `cargo` crate.

Resolves #54

title: Allow wrapped crate
body:
This PR introduces a new option in the bans section, `allow-if-wrapped`, which will allow any banned dependency which
is the child of a specified wrapper crate.

Resolves #225

title: Improve sources check
body:
* Add ability to allow entire `github.com`, `gitlab.com`, or `bitbucket.org` organizations/users instead of 1 `allow-git` entry per unique git source.
* Add linting of the [specifiers](https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/specifying-dependencies.html#specifying-dependencies-from-git-repositories) used on git sources.

Also cleans up tests a bit to make them easier to add and improve.

Resolves: #235
Resolves: #236

title: Fix cargo_metadata/semver incompatibilities
body:
https://github.com/oli-obk/cargo_metadata/issues/121

Resolves: #229

title: Updates dependencies
body: Small hack to work around cargo-lock using an older semver version.

title: Add wildcard check to bans check
Add feature options
body:
Add `--all-features`, `--features`, and `--no-default-features`. This is a breaking change as the default behavior is no longer `--all-features`.

Removed deprecated `--context`

Resolves: #216

title: Output cleanup
body: Cleanup the previous PR for structured output/coloring.

title: Fixup output
body:
Added `--color` which takes the options `auto`, `always`, or `never` to turn on or off coloring for all output.

Added `--format` which takes the options `human` or `json`. The Json option writes each distinct output as a single Json object.

Resolves: #137
Resolves: #211

title: Cleanup output
body:
- Downgraded several `info` messages to `debug` to remove spam.
- Added timings for each type of check
- Added a summary line printed at the end (except if the log level is Off) to show the success or failure of each check that was Requesting
- Added a `-s|--show-stats` flag to the `check` subcommand that will display the number of errors, warnings, and info/notes/debug helps for each check. Printed regardless of the log-level.

Resolves: https://github.com/EmbarkStudios/cargo-deny-action/issues/17

title: Update cfg-expr
body:
The new cfg-expr allows us to more easily support custom targets that aren't built-in to rustc.

Also updates the rest of our dependencies.

title: Fixup CD setup
body:
* Use [@embark-bot](https://github.com/embark-bot) for publishing releases and auto-merging
* Use latest automerge action

title: Fix infinite loop when creating a graph for a project with cyclic dependencies
body:
Fixes #184

I am not well acquainted with the codebase. Not sure how those KrateSpans are connected with `bans::check`, just created them analogously to existing tests.
Ideally, there should be some integration tests infra. I hand-rolled a test project in `tests/test_data/cyclic_dependencies` just for this case.

cc @Jake-Shadle
